alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 12:19PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT AREAS NEAR KENDRICK PEAK IN COCONINO COUNTY THROUGH 1245 PM MST... At 1217 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Parks, or 19 miles northwest of Flagstaff. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will impact areas mostly near Kendrick Peak. This includes the following highways... State Route 64 between mile markers 196 and 197. Highway 180 between mile markers 227 and 255. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
